column3: School of Engineering and Applied Science
column5: The Master of Science in Electrical Engineering is designed to help students understand and apply the principles of electrical engineering to the next generation of technologies improving communications, power and energy systems and micro- and nano-electronics.Areas of FocusStudents working toward the master of science degree may choose one of the following focus areas for their studies:Communications and NetworksElectrical Power and EnergyElectronics, Photonics and MEMSSignal and Image Processing, Systems, and ControlsOnline and On-Site OptionsIf you are seeking to complete this program online, please view the requirements and apply at the online Master of Science in Electrical Engineering website.
column9: 2 years full time, 3 years part time
